code_source.last_log: Merging MP:153721. Allow config option for providing SSL chain certificates file very much like what we have for certificates and private keys. Also fixed up so that ssl_key is ignored when ssl_cert is specified as SELFSIGNED like what the description in config.yaml says.

revisions.message: Merging MP:153721. Allow config option for providing SSL chain certificates file very much like what we have for certificates and private keys. Also fixed up so that ssl_key is ignored when ssl_cert is specified as SELFSIGNED like what the description in config.yaml says.
remove website-relation-changed hook... just do this in joined
Add config variable to use 'restart' or 'reload' in the config_changed hook
Remove incomplete implementation of rsyslog functionality, look for relation solution coming soon

description:
The Apache Software Foundation's goal is to build a secure, efficient
and extensible HTTP server as standards-compliant open source
software. The result has long been the number one web server on the
Internet.  It features support for HTTPS, virtual hosting, CGI, SSI,
IPv6, easy scripting and database integration, request/response
filtering, many flexible authentication schemes, and more.
name: apache2

config_change_command.description:
The command to run whenever config has changed. Accepted values are
"reload" or "restart" - any other value will mean neither is executed
after a config change (which may be desired, if you're running a
production server and would rather handle these out of band). Note:
some variables like the mpm settings require a restart to go into effect.

lb_balancer_timeout.description: How long the backends in mod_proxy_balancer will timeout, in seconds

logrotate_count.description: The number of days we want to retain logs for

logrotate_dateext.description: Use daily extension like YYYMMDD instead of simply adding a number

nagios_check_http_params.description: The parameters to pass to the nrpe plugin check_http.

nagios_context.description:
Used by the nrpe-external-master subordinate charm. A string that will be prepended to instance name to set the host name in nagios. So for instance the hostname would be something like:
    juju-postgresql-0
If you're running multiple environments with the same services in them this allows you to differentiate between them.

server_signature.description: Security setting. Set to one of  On  Off  EMail

server_tokens.description: Security setting. Set to one of  Full  OS  Minimal  Minor  Major  Prod

servername.description: ServerName for vhost, defaults to the units public-address

ssl_cert.description:
base64 encoded server certificate.  If the keyword 'SELFSIGNED'
is used, the certificate and key will be autogenerated as
self-signed.

ssl_certlocation.description:
Name and location of ssl certificate in charm/data directory.
If not found, will ignore.  Basename of this file will be used
as the basename of the cert rooted at /etc/ssl/certs.  Can
be used in conjunction with the ssl_cert parameter to specify
the cert as a configuration setting.

ssl_chain.description:
base64 encoded chain certificates file.  If ssl_cert is
specified as SELFSIGNED, this will be ignored.

ssl_chainlocation.description:
Name and location of the ssl chain file.  Basename of this file
will be used as the basename of the chain file rooted at
/etc/ssl/certs.

ssl_key.description:
base64 encoded server certificate key.  If ssl_cert is
specified as SELFSIGNED, this will be ignored.

ssl_keylocation.description:
Name and location of ssl keyfile in charm/data directory.
If not found, will ignore.  Basename of this file will be used
as the basename of the key rooted at /etc/ssl/private.  Can
be used in conjuntion with the ssl_key parameter to specify
the key as a configuration setting.

trace_enabled.description: Security setting. Set to one of  On  Off  extended

use_rsyslog.description: Change logging behaviour to log both access and error logs via rsyslog
